alert.note: Alert for Southern Graham-Central and Eastern Cochise-Southern Greenlee-Lower Elevations of the San Carlos Apache Nation in Graham County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 24 at 2:50AM MST until April 25 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG AND GUSTY WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 152... The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 152, which includes the lower elevations of Graham and Greenlee counties and the eastern two thirds of Cochise county. * TIMING...Tuesday afternoon into Tuesday evening. * WINDS...West to northwest 20-foot winds 20 to 25 mph with gusts between 35 and 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY..As low as 8 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop or are ongoing will have the potential to spread rapidly. * FOR A DETAILED VIEW OF THE HAZARD AREA...Visit weather.gov/Tucson and click on the Detailed Hazards Icon.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of the Fire Weather Watch for portions of Southeast Arizona.

area.areaDesc: Southern Graham-Central and Eastern Cochise-Southern Greenlee-Lower Elevations of the San Carlos Apache Nation in Graham County
